title: Graça Machel | UN Office for Partnerships

quotes: She created the Graça Machel Trust in 2010 where she focuses on advocating for women’s economic and financial empowerment, food security and nutrition, education for all, as well as good governance.

quotes: Graça Machel | UN Office for Partnerships

organizations.name: Foundation for Community Development
quotes: She founded and serves as President of the Foundation for Community Development and the Zizile Institute for Child Development.

organizations.name: UNICEF
quotes: In the years following her tenure in government, Machel produced a ground-breaking UNICEF report “The Impact of Armed Conflict on Children” that changed the way the United Nations and member states respond in conflict zones.

organizations.name: The Elders
quotes: Machel is a founding member and Deputy Chair of The Elders, and played a key role in establishing Girls Not Brides.

quotes: She is a member of the UN Secretary-General’s Sustainable Development Goals Advocacy Group and sits on the High-Level Steering Group for Every Woman Every Child.

quotes: She is a member of the UN Secretary-General’s Sustainable Development Goals Advocacy Group and sits on the High-Level Steering Group for Every Woman Every Child.

organizations.name: Africa Child Policy Forum
quotes: She serves as Board Chair of the Africa Child Policy Forum, Board Chair of the African Centre for the Constructive Resolution of Disputes, Board Chair of United People Global as well as Executive Chair of the Mandela Institute for Development Studies.

Graça Machel is an African stateswoman whose decades long professional and public life is rooted in Mozambique’s struggle for self-rule and international advocacy for women and children’s rights.
She is a former freedom fighter in Mozambique’s FRELIMO movement and that country’s first Minister of Education.
